title: Extremely slow to turn on lights
text:
In order to connect to the lights/speakers, you must go in to settings > bluetooth and connect to the device EVERY time you leave range. It does not automatically reconnect after leaving range. That is just to use the speakers.

To control the lights, you have to download and open the Pulse app. Ok, no big deal. But if I want to turn on the lights, I have to go to settings > bluetooth, connect to the lights. Then I have to open the Pulse app (I usually wait 10 or so seconds before opening it, because I find if I open the app immediately after connecting to bluetooth, I end up waiting indefinitely), and then the Pulse app needs to do its own connection to the lights. From there, you can control the lights. Turning on the lights generally takes ~35 seconds (I timed it). To me, this is completely impractical as a primary light source in any space.

Only one device can be connected to the lights/speakers at any time, so if my husband wants to turn out his light while we're in bed, it can only be done on my phone.

There is a no Apple Watch compatibility.

title: Nice product and app but a few limitations
text:
The product itself is a neat ideas.
Sound quality is decent for such a small speaker.
However, there are a few annoying features or limitations.
1). Every time you switch the bulb on, there is an audible beep for the speaker Bluetooth.  If you happen to turn in the light at night when someone is sleeping, even from another room it can be heard.  There is no option that I could find to disable this audible beep.  This should be fixable if Sengled were to choose to change this.
2). When you shut off the light switch, the last persons device that was connected to Bluetooth speaker remains ready to connect the next time the slight switch, preventing another family meme bet to connect unless the previous person deliberately disconnects their device before shutting off the switch.  I think this should be made an option in the app so that the owner can choose to administer the setting for last connected or next to connect.
3). The lightbulb has a warm white light in its default.  While the maker claims millions of colors are achievable, I have not been able to achieve a cool white white if 5000k to match the other regular LED bulbs that this Sengled bulb is installed on.  I think that this is a programming shortcoming that should be correctable yo be able to choose a cool white or warm white for default.

I hope that Sengled is paying attention to the ratings and comments and can fix these shortcomings, which in my opinion would I trade the rating to five stars.

title: Easy to use
text:
This app is very well designed with an intuitive interface. Controlling the speaker volume and light dimming is easy. Adding new speakers or a subwoofer is also straightforward. You don't need this app to use your Pulse lights, but it makes certain things easier. Volume and equalization can be controlled using whatever app you play music from. So the main uses of the Pulse app are controlling the light level, configuring new speakers, and setting the speakers to stereo or mono. It does these things well. 

The app is very simple. As the technology evolves, I'd like to see more features added. One missing feature that seems important is the ability to control the volume of individual speakers. I have the Pulse lights in a room with a sloped ceiling. So the lower ones seem much louder than the upper ones. A volume control for each speaker would completely fix this.

title: Interface issues
text: I feel like the app should have both audio and lighting controls on the very first page. No flipping back and forth, no going to the upper right for settings for lights or sounds. All choices for settings and lights should be made to fit the first page you land on.  Also, it appears that my sound coming from the system if I turn the physical light switch off is defaulted to 80%. I'd like to see this turned into and option instead . Like the record last brightness feature. Most of us would prefer to use our devices to control the max volume and not the app.  Efficiency makes the app better. Not having to use the app, makes the experience even better. :)
